subdivision_of_building: A full planning application for the replacement of existing windows at the front and rear elevations (excluding the commercial shopfronts) as well as the removal of the chimney stacks on the rear elevation of 89 – 91 Wimbledon High Street, London, SW19 5EG.
description: REPLACEMENT OF WINDOWS ON A LIKE-FOR-LIKE BASIS AT 89-91 WIMBLEDON HIGH STREET
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Drawing no: 1474-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-002 -P1(Site Plan) Dated 19  December 2024
Drawing no: 1474-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-001 -P1(Site Location Plan) Dated 19 December 2024 
Drawing no: 1474-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-821 -P3(Proposed Rear Elevation Units ) Dated 07 March 2025
Drawing no: -1 474-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A830 -Rev P1(Proposed Sections Typical Window Unit) Dated 21.02.25 
Drawing no: -1 474 - ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-110 -RevP2 (Proposed Floor Plan Unit 89) Dated 19.12.24 
Drawing no:14 74-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-110 -RevP2(Proposed windows to be replaced like-for-like on Basement Level Plan, Ground Floor Plan, First Floor Plan and Second Floor Plan) Dated 19 December 2024
Drawing no: 1474-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-820 -P2(Proposed Front Elevation Units 89-91) Dated 19 December 20204
Drawing no: 1474-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-822 -P2(Proposed Section Unit 89) Dated 19 December 2024
Drawing no:1474-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-111 -P2(Proposed Floor Plans Unit 90) Dated 19 December 2024 
Drawing no: 1474-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-112 -P2(Proposed Floor Plans Unit 91) Dated 19 December 2024  
Drawing no: 1474-ALN-ESL- 00-D-A-022 -P2(Existing Section No. 89 - 91, Wimbledon High Street) Dated 07 March 2025
HERITAGE STATEMENT Dated  19 December 2024.

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The Applicant is advised that the Existing Chemneys Stack in these Locally Listed Buildings must not be Removed and must be retained as part of the Historic Fabric of these Locally Listed Buildings in the Wimbledon Village Conservation Area. 

Reason: To retain the Historic Fabric of the Original Design of these Locally Listed buildings incompliance the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) 2024,Chapter 16 Conserving and enhancing the historic environmen, the London Plan (LP) 2021 -Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth and the Merton Local Plan (MLP) 2024-2037/28 -Policy D12.5 Managing Heritage Assets

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was amended following negotiations with the Council Conservation Officer to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made without delay  with an agreed  Extension OF Time determination date  18  March 2025. .

iii) The application was recommended for approval and referred to the first available Planning Committee, where the agents / applicants had an opportunity to present the application.
